body:
Comment 3: 
No. The grammar is defined exactly (modulo not yet known bugs) by the specs. Only the
EBNF is sometimes inexact (simplified). This simplification makes the EBNF more
comprehensible, even though only structurally valid (exact). Where the EBNF is not
exact, the surrounding text specifies the exact rules. It's the same as e.g. any other
constraints/limitations, which are not at all expressible by EBNF (scope redeclaration
for example, type compatibility, number limits, ...).
